Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by applying the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.5 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners, with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.5 - Height: 0.75 Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.0, 0.148] Now, construct a 2D sketch on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.3911, 0.477] - Line 2: Starting at [0.3911, 0.477], ending at [0.0, 0.477] - Line 3: Starting at [0.0, 0.477], ending at [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop to form a face. Apply a scaling factor of 0.477 to the sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by applying the following euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.0, 0.148] Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following extrusion properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.5 * Sketch scale: 0.477 The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top, with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.5 - Width: 0.477 - Height: 0.477</description>

Step 6: Transform the Scaled 2D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 7: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis with a depth equal to the desired height of the hole. This will create the cylindrical hole through the rectangular prism assembled in Part 1. Once completed, the resulting CAD model should match the final shape described in the JSON.</description>
